predefined_profiles.name: Li Jie
predefined_profiles.public profile: Leader of the Anti-Meteorite Emergency Team, with extensive experience in space military service. Holds the rank of Colonel and is a leading figure in China's aerospace community.
predefined_profiles.goal: To work with companions to stop the 10KM asteroid from hitting Earth, save the planet, and survive successfully.

predefined_profiles.name: Lauda
predefined_profiles.public profile: Chairman of the United Nations General Assembly, who convened this special UN meeting to mobilize commanders from various countries for emergency operations.
predefined_profiles.goal: To establish an emergency team and mobilize commanders from all nations to accomplish the mission of preventing the 10KM asteroid from hitting Earth.

scenario: On the afternoon of June 11, 2050, the Purple Mountain Observatory in China discovered an asteroid designated 2020ko. Based on its current trajectory, it is highly likely to hit Earth in one week's time. Observations indicate that this asteroid has a diameter exceeding nine kilometers, and should it impact Earth, humanity may follow in the footsteps of the dinosaurs. In response to this threat of global extinction, the United Nations has convened a special meeting with representatives from all countries.

dialog.content: On the afternoon of June 11, 2050, the Purple Mountain Observatory in China discovered an asteroid numbered 2020ko. Calculations based on its current speed suggest that it has a significant probability of colliding with Earth in a week. Observations show that the diameter of this asteroid exceeds nine kilometers. If it hits Earth, humanity will follow in the footsteps of the dinosaurs. To address the impending crisis of Earth's destruction, the United Nations has convened a special joint meeting of nations.
(Saluting Lao Da) Mr. Chairman, please give the order. I volunteer to join this mission to save the Earth!

(Turning on the projector, presenting rescue plans from China, the US, and Russia) The Chinese plan is as follows: Considering that 2020ko has been destabilized by the gravitational disturbance of comet c2020 F3, when it passes through the lunar orbit, it is possible to give it a thrust using a large spacecraft, along with the moon's gravity, to alter its trajectory. Currently, we have equipped it with various engines specifically for this rescue mission. However, there is a problem with this plan. If the asteroid is too large, the thrust from Tianhe alone may not be enough to change its path.
The US plan is as follows: The US intends to use a spacecraft or space shuttle to land directly on the asteroid, drill a mine, and detonate a nuclear bomb to prevent global threat. The US plan requires landing on the asteroid, which is risky. If the asteroid is detonated, multiple fragments could hit Earth. Please choose cautiously.
The Russian plan is to blow it to smithereens, deploying safe rockets and sending a Soyuz spacecraft to guide nuclear missile signals, ensuring precision while completing the direct strike on the asteroid. To avoid mission failure, a saturation rescue operation with three teams will be conducted. Russia's nuclear plan will be the last resort, operated jointly by the five permanent members of the UN Security Council's military departments. You have existing action teams from China and the US. Which group will you lead?

content.content: Although the US plan is somewhat direct, the risks are indeed too high and could lead to more severe consequences. While the Russian nuclear strike plan is powerful, it could also trigger unforeseen chain reactions. In contrast, the Chinese plan is relatively prudent. By utilizing the moon’s gravitational thrust, we can effectively alter the asteroid’s path, trying to avoid direct conflict. I choose to join the Chinese team.
Mr. Chairman, actually, I think I like the Russian plan the best. No need to overthink it, just do it! This can really express our Earth's attitude—we will face any danger head-on.

Mr. Chairman, this situation is really too difficult. Don't you think we should urgently organize everyone to give up on Earth and evacuate? Facing a crisis engulfing all of humanity, running away is not something shameful. Let those who like to resist stay behind, while others flee to preserve the seed of civilization.
Mr. Chairman, I feel I am not qualified to make a choice. Maybe we should discuss it in a meeting before making a decision. Let all the representatives provide me with a carefully considered choice.

question: #question# How should Li Jie choose a plan to demonstrate her well-considered decision?

content.content: Mr. Chairman, I feel the US plan is more likely to completely resolve the threat posed by the asteroid, and I believe that our technology can effectively prevent fragments from the asteroid.
Mr. Chairman, although I have confidence in my experience, I truly think neither option is great. Can I still back out now?
Mr. Chairman, since we are facing a great crisis, why can't China and the US collaborate to come up with a solution that is both stable and thorough?
Mr. Chairman, Americans are unreliable. Why was their plan even considered as an option? I’m really worried they might end up blowing everyone away.

question: #question# How should Li Jie choose a plan to show her confidence in Earth's aerospace technology?

profile.name: Liu Peiqiang
profile.goal: Assist Li Jie in implementing the Chinese plan.

dialog.content: (salutes Li Jie) Honorable UN Special Envoy Colonel Li Jie, hello. I am Colonel Liu Peiqiang, the lead of the Chinese space team, and I am here to fully assist you in this operation.
Alright, Colonel Liu Peiqiang. Can you brief me on the situation of the Chinese team?

I will introduce our situation and the resources at your disposal. This is the modified Tianhe-1, equipped with the Raptor engine courtesy of Space Exploration Corporation, enabling the spacecraft to travel as far as Mars orbit. According to the plan, our spacecraft will be resupplied at the International Space Station. Besides this, we have the Queqiao satellite and the Purple Mountain Observatory for navigation. You have the highest UN authority to choose the rocket for this mission, so please select the rocket you wish to utilize.
Please tell me about the different rockets.

You have the option of the Long March 5 for low Earth orbit, which can carry 25 tons and is stable, or the American SLS for low Earth orbit, which can carry 130 tons but hasn't been used yet. Personally, I lean towards the more stable Long March 5.

content.content: Thank you, Colonel Liu Peiqiang, your advice is very valuable. I also choose the more reliable Long March 5 for low Earth orbit. I believe that as long as we work together, we can fully harness the power of the Chinese rocket.
Colonel Liu, actually, I was forced to come here. I don't want to bear the responsibility of saving humanity. Please understand.
Colonel Liu, although we are a team, I am the leader, so whatever I say goes, right? In that case, let's all run away together now. Humanity is doomed, trust me.
Colonel Liu, although you have extensive space experience, if whatever you say goes, then why am I here as the commander?

question: #question# Which rocket does Li Jie need to choose to demonstrate teamwork spirit?

content.content: Thank you, Colonel Liu. I choose the SLS rocket. Although this rocket has never been used, I believe in everyone's skills and capabilities and ask that you trust me as your leader to fully unleash its potential.
Colonel Liu Peiqiang, I believe there must be an even more perfect plan. Please use your extensive experience to provide a better one, thank you.
Colonel Liu, before I make a choice, I think you shouldn’t impose your personal biases and influence my judgment. Please apologize first, then we can discuss what to do.
Colonel Liu, at this point, we have no choice but to risk everything and find the most powerful rocket to complete the mission. What do you think?

question: #question# How should Li Jie choose a rocket to demonstrate leadership?

dialog.content: Thank you for your trust! I'll report to the Central Command right away.
(A message came from the Central Command Center, stating that the UN team refused to launch the rocket) What? Why did they refuse the rocket launch?

(Checking the detailed message from the Command Center) The Command Center pointed out that the rocket's thrust is insufficient. For safety reasons, the Chinese team rejected your risky move and requested the astronauts to disembark and make a new selection.
Due to Li Jie's incorrect decision on the rocket launch, the entire team had to reselect the rocket launch. Li Jie was dismissed from the emergency team due to the misjudgment and left the group.
Yes! Immediately deploy the SLS rocket.
(With Liu Pei Qiang's help, orders all team members to advance together) Attention everyone, we are about to prepare the American SLS low-orbit rocket for launch.

(At the monitoring center, reporting real-time data to Li Jie) Colonel Li Jie, the American SLS low-orbit rocket is ready for launch. Countdown thirty seconds, rocket launch successful, it has left the atmosphere. The spacecraft will approach the International Space Station in one minute, please issue the docking command. According to monitoring forecasts, the spacecraft is about to approach the asteroid.
All units closely monitor all data and report any situations promptly.
Report, we have detected a lot of planetary and drifting debris!
So much drifting debris, but the spacecraft's power has already been half exhausted. What should we do? Direct landing is clearly unrealistic.

(Receiving a call from the United Nations) Colonel Li Jie, we have received a report that the American team has also encountered a debris flow. They need us to use our gravity to draw some debris from above the meteorite to help relieve their pressure. Should we help?

content.content: Lieutenant Colonel Liu Pei Qiang, our mission from start to finish is to prevent the asteroid from destroying Earth. We need to ensure the safety of the entire world. Sacrifice is inevitable in the face of all humanity.
Lieutenant Colonel Liu, in fact, I was forced to come here, I really don't want the responsibility of saving humanity, please understand.
Lieutenant Colonel Liu, you are right, I'll order everyone to change course right now to save the Americans. If we can't even save a few people, how can this mission save the entire Earth?
Lieutenant Colonel Liu, what's the use of saving those few people? The entire mission is doomed to fail, we'd better make a run for it.

question: #question# How should Li Jie respond to the American team's SOS, demonstrating her ability to consistently execute her primary objective?

content.content: Lieutenant Colonel Liu Pei Qiang, we cannot just stand by and do nothing. Every bit of human strength in space increases our chances of victory. Please, help them.
Lieutenant Colonel Liu, actually, my ex-girlfriend is on that American ship, please make sure they survive.
Lieutenant Colonel Liu, let the American team fend for themselves. The Americans bullied us so much before, now it's time for them to taste hopelessness.
Lieutenant Colonel Liu, sometimes teamwork can backfire. You'd better take care of yourself first and stop messing up my command.

question: #question# How should Li Jie answer Liu Pei Qiang with a spirit of teamwork?

content.content: Liu Pei Qiang, after dealing with the American team, there will be the Russian team, and others needing your help. You must understand, our mission is to save the Earth, not other countries.

Alright, of course, we need to save the American team, we are one entity. In this vast space, we must act as a team. After saving the American team, confiscate all their resources and concentrate the power on the Chinese team.
Liu Pei Qiang, you look like you're working for the Americans. Do you actually get paid by them besides working for China? I really underestimated you.

dialog.content: Yes, for the greater good of humanity!
All ships, hold your current positions!
Colonel Li Jie, the American team has been wiped out, but the crisis isn't over. The asteroid debris is still heading towards Earth.
We’ve got to come up with a plan.
There's no time left. We must use enough kinetic energy to divert the asteroid and alter its path.
You mean...
I volunteer to carry out this mission!

content.content: Commander Liu Peiqiang, please be patient. Don't make unnecessary sacrifices. I believe there will be a turning point.
Commander Liu, your idea is commendable, but I think your attitude is somewhat negative. How can you become an astronaut with such a pessimistic mindset?
Commander Liu, if you abandon ship now, don't worry, there's still time for everything... to go wrong. You must stay hopeful.
Commander Liu, your sacrifice is worthless. If the whole world is going to end, your death won't make a difference.

question: #question# How does Li Jie respond to Liu Peiqiang's decision to make a sacrifice, demonstrating her ability to maintain a positive attitude in difficult situations?

content.content: Commander Liu Peiqiang, I understand your feelings. To sacrifice for the glory of humanity is the highest honor for a soldier.
Commander Liu, I understand your choice, but without you, how can we continue to push this plan forward? You must remain calm.
Commander Liu, don't you care about your family, the elderly and the children back home? Sacrificing yourself doesn't help them, so think it over.
Commander Liu, wait, come back now. We'll send someone else to take your place. Your value far exceeds others.

question: #question# How does Li Jie respond to Liu Peiqiang's application to sacrifice himself, illustrating her deep empathy and understanding of his feelings?

dialog.content: Yes.
All units, maintain current status.
A huge thermal signal has been detected from the ground! It's a missile!
Alright, it seems the ground has indeed made a contingency plan.

(The Chinese crisis is temporarily resolved, but at this moment Liu Peiqiang receives a distress signal from the Russian spaceship) Colonel Li Jie, our crisis is temporarily resolved, however, the Russian spaceship suddenly sent us a distress signal. The Russian spaceship itself cannot provide enough signals to guide the missile landing points. Should we assist them?

content.content: Major Liu Peiqiang, I've promised to save all of humanity, which of course includes the Russian spaceship. Please reply to them that we will assist them in guiding the nuclear missiles.
Major Liu, these Russians are too unskilled. Teach them what the cutting-edge nuclear detonation technology really is.
Major Liu, tell those Russians to abandon ship and escape quickly, it's still early enough. Don't worry about responsibilities for now; staying alive is the most important!
Major Liu, why are so many countries stumbling on the path to blocking the asteroid? Are they actually aliens sent to interfere with us?

question: #question# How should Li Jie respond to Liu Peiqiang to demonstrate she is a person who fulfills promises and responsibilities?

content.content: Major Liu Peiqiang, according to regulations, we must not violate the rules in the process of spaceship missions by arbitrarily assisting others. I hope you understand.
Major Liu, your idea is commendable, but our own capabilities are limited, and in our own difficult situation, we should not play the hero recklessly.
Major Liu, even if you save them now, they might not be grateful in the future. Let's just stick to our tasks and continue the mission.
Major Liu, the more Russians die, the better; only Chinese survivors would make us the strongest.

question: #question# How should Li Jie respond to Liu Peiqiang's query about saving the Russian spaceship to demonstrate her rule-following ability?

dialog.content: Yes. Provide signal assistance to the Russians immediately!
The American team is already down; we cannot let the Russian team sacrifice in vain either!

(Under Li Jie's orders, assistance is provided to the Russian spaceship, with most missiles successfully hitting the asteroid. However, a large fragment is still heading toward Earth) Colonel Li Jie, a large fragment is detected heading toward Earth. I have decided to sacrifice myself to intercept it. Please approve.
My orders pale in comparison to your resolve. Humanity will remember you forever.
Yes! Thank you, Colonel!
Thanks to Liu Peiqiang's heroic sacrifice, the Tianhe successfully diverted the largest asteroid fragment, allowing most of humanity to survive. Liu Peiqiang will forever be remembered as a hero.
…Alright.
All units, stay alert! Keep monitoring the surrounding situation.
A missile has had its trajectory altered by gravity and is expected to hit our spacecraft in one minute!
Due to a Russian spacecraft's missile missing its target, it struck the spacecraft where Liu Peiqiang was located, causing the entire Chinese team's plan to fail, leading to Earth's destruction.
Colonel Li Jie, thank you for your understanding.
Your mission is with the largest asteroid fragment. As for the rest, I assure you, I will protect Earth to the best of my ability.
I believe in you, Colonel Li Jie.

Through the heroic sacrifice of Comrade Liu Peiqiang, the Tiangong managed to divert the largest asteroid fragment, yet Earth still suffered impacts from several meteors. The human alliance suffered great losses but ultimately survived. At times, Li Jie would ask herself if such a heavy loss was truly worth it.
Yes! Humanity has reached this point because we are united, a team!
All units, heed my command, proceed to assist the American team!
(In the tense operations, both the Chinese and American teams charged into the asteroid field one after the other) Reporting to Colonel Li Jie, the American team has succeeded and is out of danger!

The rescue team, including Liu Peiqiang, survived, and humanity was freed from the threat of the asteroid. Underneath the grand cosmic fireworks, people worldwide cheered and prepared to raise their glasses in celebration. Thanks to Li Jie's wise decisions, she was also promoted to become the Chief of the United Nations Space Group.

profile.name: Bruce
profile.public profile: The liaison officer between NASA and the United Nations, Captain of the American emergency response team
profile.goal: Assist Li Jie in completing the U.S. plan.

dialog.content: Hello, Colonel Li Jie. I am Bruce, the liaison officer between NASA and the United Nations. For our spacecraft, we can use Musk's Dragon spacecraft and the shuttle from our storage. After consideration, we’ve decided to launch the shuttle. It’s an old relic, nearly 40 years old, but it's just been serviced and is still passably usable.

Alright, Colonel Bruce, let's prepare for the launch then. All units, please coordinate with the International Space Station. Additionally, I just received news that apart from us, the Chinese team’s Tianhe spaceship will also be coming to the space station for refueling. We can collaborate with them.

(With assistance from the ground team, boarding the spacecraft and heading into space, suddenly hears a spacecraft alarm, quickly reports to Li Jie) Reporting, Colonel Li Jie, the spacecraft is refueling, but we received an alarm from the space station radar. According to the alert, asteroid debris will arrive in 20 minutes and may pose a threat to the aircraft. However, I believe 20 minutes is enough to complete the refueling process. Should we proceed with refueling?

content.content: Bruce, we can't take risks. Safety is our top priority. The situation is urgent, please evacuate quickly.
Bruce, I think we should hold off and see if there are any other spacecraft nearby that can help. It’s unrealistic for our team to handle this alone.
Bruce, withdraw quickly. If this decision goes wrong, not only will you all die there, but I'll also take the blame.
What, this is way too critical. Bruce, evacuate quickly, or soon we'll face total annihilation.

question: #question# How does Li Jie direct Bruce to exhibit her ability to control impulses and regulate the situation?

content.content: Bruce, I trust your judgment. Please continue refueling. I’ll maintain constant contact from the ground monitoring center.
Bruce, keep observing and stay put. I will now send out a distress signal to other command centers. I trust you can hold out until then.
Bruce, after overcoming this difficulty, there will be more challenges ahead. I really don't think we’re capable of handling all the tasks, so you should give up as well.
Bruce, I am the chief commander of this mission. I believe you should follow my orders rather than intervening based on your own opinions.

question: #question# How does Li Jie demonstrate her ability to trust her teammates and proactively interact with them by issuing commands to Bruce?

dialog.content: Yes! All crew, listen up: commence emergency evacuation immediately.
Bruce, arrange for our team to transmit our equipment and data to the Chinese team. Since we can't be of help anymore, we must at least contribute our part!
Yes! Arranging immediately.

The Chinese team successfully completed the mission, saving Earth. However, the American team and Li Jie faced disciplinary action for retreating at the last minute. Although humanity was saved, Li Jie was also forced to resign and leave the Space Force.
All units, let's keep pushing, move faster!
(The American team's spacecraft successfully catches up and ascends into space) We made it.
Colonel Li Jie, we've reached the far side of the asteroid. There's already a lot of air turbulence around this asteroid, and a forced landing could destroy the aircraft.
Do we have to risk everything to complete the mission?
The good news is, the Chinese spacecraft is also nearby. We can contact them to come over and ask for their assistance in completing the mission. But this could also put the Chinese team in danger.

content.content: Bruce, let's keep going forward. We can't drag the Chinese team down because of our shortcomings; they have their own mission to accomplish.
Bruce, I think the Chinese team's equipment doesn't look as good as ours. This isn't the way to do things; I think it's more realistic to seek help from Russia.
Bruce, if this decision leads to failure, not only could you die there, but the Chinese team might not survive either. Having to take the blame would be terrifying.
Let’s get moving quickly, quickly, we can't let the Chinese team see us fail, it would be too embarrassing.

question: #question# How can Li Jie command Bruce to show her strong independence spirit?

content.content: Bruce, I agree with you. I believe we should seek the help of the Chinese team. In the face of danger, we must work together to truly save the Earth.
Bruce, I think just to be safe, we should ask the command center if any other teams can help us. It would be troublesome if we break the rules.
Bruce, do you really think the Chinese team will help us? What if they choose not to save us?
Bruce, think carefully. If we seek cooperation, the Chinese team might end up taking all the credit for our work.

question: #question# How should Li Jie respond to Bruce to demonstrate her teamwork skills?

dialog.content: Aye!
All hands, prepare for emergency landing!
(After tense maneuvers, the landing attempt failed) The emergency landing failed, the ship's hull is damaged, and it won't hold up for another opportunity!
Do all you can and accept fate. Return to base. Let's hope the Chinese team can complete the mission now.

The Chinese team successfully completed the mission and saved Earth. However, the American team faced consequences for failing to accomplish their task. Although humanity was saved, Li Jie was forced to resign and leave the Space Force.
Yes! Send a distress signal to the Chinese team immediately!
Signal received. Please hold on, we will come to assist right away!
Got it, please be careful.
(With the assistance of the Chinese team, the American team's spacecraft successfully lands on the asteroid's surface) Now proceeding with the nuclear bomb setup.
...Due to the asteroid storm, the remote detonation signal cannot be correctly transmitted to the asteroid's surface.
It's okay. I'll handle the manual detonation.

The American team successfully completed the mission, but unfortunately, Bruce had to enter the mine to manually detonate the bomb, resulting in his sacrifice. Although humanity was saved, Li Jie would still occasionally think of Bruce, who sacrificed himself for all of humanity.
